Package camzup.kotlin

Class KtVec3

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.Vec3
camzup.kotlin.KtVec3
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Vec3>, Iterable<Float>
public class KtVec3 extends Vec3 implements Iterable<Float>
Provides Kotlin operator overloading support for three dimensional vectors.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static final class 
    KtVec3.V3Iterator
    An iterator, which allows a vector's components to be accessed in an enhanced for loop.

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the evaluation
      See Also:

    • dec

      public KtVec3 dec()
      Returns a new vector decremented by one. For interoperability with Kotlin: --a (prefix) or a-- (postfix). Per the specification, does not mutate the vector in place.
      Returns:
      the decremented vector

    • div

      public KtVec3 div(float b)
      Returns a new vector with the division of the instance by the right operand. For interoperability with Kotlin: a / b . Does not mutate the vector in place.
      Parameters:
      b - the right operand
      Returns:
      the quotient

    • div

      public KtVec3 div(Vec3 b)

      Parameters:
      b - the right operand
      Returns:
      the quotient
      See Also:

    • divAssign

      public void divAssign(float b)
      Divides the instance by the right operand (mutates the vector in place). For interoperability with Kotlin: a /= b .
      Parameters:
      b - the right operand

      Parameters:

    • get

      public float get(int index)
      Simulates bracket subscript access in an array. When the provided index is 2 or -1, returns z; 1 or -2, y; 0 or -3, x.
      Parameters:
      index - the index
      Returns:
      the component at that index

    • inc

      public KtVec3 inc()
      Returns a new vector incremented by one. For interoperability with Kotlin: ++a (prefix) or a++ (postfix). Per the specification, does not mutate the vector in place.
      Returns:
      the incremented vector

    • set

      public void set(int index, float value)
      Simulates bracket subscript access in an array. When the provided index is 3 or -1, sets w; 2 or -2, z; 1 or -3, y; 0 or -4, x.
      Parameters:
      index - the index
      value - the value

    • times

      public KtVec3 times(float b)
      Returns a new vector with the product of the instance and the right operand. For interoperability with Kotlin: a * b . Does not mutate the vector in place.
      Parameters:
      b - the right operand
      Returns:
      the product

    • times

      public KtVec3 times(Mat3 b)
      Returns a new vector with the product of the instance and the right operand. Following GLSL convention, multiplies a vector and the transpose of a matrix.

      vT M = ( MT v )T

      For interoperability with Kotlin: a * b . Does not mutate the vector in place.
      Parameters:
      b - the right operand
      Returns:
      the product

    • times

      public KtQuat times(Quaternion b)
      The product of the instance, promoted to a quaternion, and another quaternion. Returns a quaternion. For interoperability with Kotlin: a * b . Does not mutate the vector in place.
      Parameters:
      b - the quaternion
      Returns:
      the product

    • times

      public KtVec3 times(Vec3 b)
      Returns a new vector with the Hadamard product of the instance and the right operand. For interoperability with Kotlin: a * b . Does not mutate the vector in place.
      Parameters:
      b - the right operand
      Returns:
      the product
